utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, uh, Priya’s calling in a few minutes on Skype, and we are gonna have a dinner date.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s eight o’clock in the morning in Mumbai. How can she have dinner?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Fine, whatever. Priya will be having breakfast.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right, so technically it’s not a dinner date. I suppose you could call it a, uh, dinfast date. But if you did, you’d open yourself to peer-based mocking, such as, Hey, Leonard, how was your dinfast with Priya last night?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That doesn’t sound like mocking.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You didn’t let me finish. Dinfast . Are those soy-based candles?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t know. Why?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Paraffin candles may contain carcinogens. Unless lung cancer is the ambiance you were going for at your dinfast. Dinfast .

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Listen, I don’t want to be rude, but Priya’s gonna be calling any minute, so…

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, yes, Priya. Leonard, you know I make a point of never interfering in your personal affairs.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes, I’ve always admired that about you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: As well you should. But I’m going to make an exception here.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, good.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Priya has moved back to India to pursue her law career. Instead of desperately trying to keep this intercontinental relationship alive, you could use that time to take up a hobby.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: A hobby?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes. I read recently about a fellow in Kansas with an enormous ball of twine. I bet you could give him a run for his money.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You know, some people might say that it’s great that we’re trying to make things work long distance. They’d say things like, love is stronger than the miles between you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: When I rise to power, those people will be sterilized.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You video-chat with Amy all the time. How is this different?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Don’t you like Amy?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Of course I like Amy.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, there’s the difference.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Excuse me, that’s Priya.

utterance.speaker: Priya (on screen)
utterance.content: Hi, Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, honey.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: I miss you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, I miss you, too.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I miss the old days when your romantic partners could be returned to the video store.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thanks for letting me stay here while Leonard Skypes with his girlfriend.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, it’s no problem. It’s actually kind of nice. You reading, me reading. We’re like an old married couple.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: If we were an old married couple, the wife would serve iced tea and snickerdoodles.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I don’t have iced tea and snickerdoodles.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: A good wife would go to the store.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I want a divorce.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Good. On the way to see the lawyer, pick up some tea and cookies. I must say, I am enjoying your new chair.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: It’s great, isn’t it?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It is. Aligns the lumbar, cradles the coccyx, balances the buttocks. This is a chair worthy of the name.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What name?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Chair.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, all right, well, I’m glad you like it. I mean, I still can’t get over the fact someone just threw it away.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, it was just sitting on the street. I paid a homeless guy ten bucks to help me get it up here.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (jumps up)
utterance.content: Oh, dear. Oh, dear. Oh, dear.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What is wrong?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’ve been sitting in garbage!

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sheldon, take it easy.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You take it easy! I need to use your shower.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I went into this marriage with so much hope.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: There’s a wet Band-Aid on the shower floor. .

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: This is fun. I’ve never used a hydraulic thermoforming press before.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Pretty sweet, huh? This little baby set the university back 175 grand.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s three minutes. Should we see what we got?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hang on.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, yeah. This is one good-looking panini.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hand me the tuna melt.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yep.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Thank you. How’s it going with the long-distance love affair?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Not easy, but we’re making it work.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: When you say making it work, does that include doing the cyber nasty?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You know, the virtual pickle tickle. The digital bow-chicka-bow-bow.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Come on, dude. This is my sister you’re talking about.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey, Leonard jiggling his junk at her through a webcam has got to be easier for you to deal with than him actually touching her with it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: There’s no junk jiggling. We just talk.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Are you insane? With high-speed Internet, you have at your fingertips the greatest advancement in the field of sex since the invention of the washcloth.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I can’t do that.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, if you don’t, you’re gonna lose Priya to some fancy guy in a turban who grew up with Kama Sutra coloring books.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: How can you be so racist?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, come on, tell me I’m wrong.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (entering)
utterance.content: Oh, Leonard, good. There you are. I need you to check my head for chair lice.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I did it last night, I’m not doing it again.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Just his head, right?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t want to talk about it. You didn’t catch bugs from Penny’s chair.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, I did. And now they’re cavorting at the base of my hair follicles like dancing hippies at the Redwood National Forest.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon, you do this all the time. You fixate on some crazy idea and then blow it way out of proportion.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Name one time I’ve ever done that.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: How about when you put GPS trackers in your garbage because you were convinced North Korean spies were stealing your doodles? The chicken nuggets you were sure were human nuggets. The strangely-shaped cloud that was following you around town. The time you put on my shirt by mistake and were convinced you’d started growing again.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I said, name one. You really need to work on your listening skills.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Penny. Penny. Penny.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yello.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You need to remove that chair from the building. It’s a health hazard.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, relax. I took off the slipcovers, had them dry-cleaned and then fumigated the cushions.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah. It’s cleaner than my couch. Found half a Hot Pocket in there.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It certainly looks okay. Has a strong toxic chemical smell. That’s reassuring.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Why don’t you give it a try, Sheldon?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right. It is a comfortable chair.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Why don’t you just admit you overreacted?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, thank you. (Sees insect. More appear and swarm all over him. He jumps out of a daydream on his own couch. Jumps up and runs out to Penny’s apartment.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s like living with a Chihuahua.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (at Penny’s door)
utterance.content: Penny. Penny. Penny.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What’s up, buttercup?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You have to get rid of the chair.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Nope.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Penny. Penny. Penny.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What’s the word, hummingbird?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: For your safety, please wait in my apartment as I call the authorities so they may remove the chair of death.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Penny. Penny. Penny.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What’s the gist, physicist?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Under my authority as a self-appointed member of the Centres for Disease Control street team, these premises are condemned. As a man with a keen sense of style, I must tell you, that chair does not work with the room. . Penny. Penny. Penny.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So, here we are. Back in bed together.

utterance.speaker: Priya (on laptop screen)
utterance.content: Yep, here we are.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, so I, I, I guess I’ll just jump right in.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, you’re a naughty girl. And, and, uh, I, I want to punish you with my love?

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Not good?

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: That’s terrible. Try again.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay. Uh, uh, you’re not naughty. Uh, you’re, you’re, you’re dirty. You’re, you’re a, a dirty girl?

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Oh, yes. Yes, I am.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah. Uh, okay. You’re a, you’re a, you’re a, a dirty, disgusting, revolting girl. Ugh!

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: God, Leonard, stop talking.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why don’t you just give me five minutes? I’ll Google how to do this. I’ll call you right back.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Shh-shh-shh. Just be quiet and do what I tell you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, like usual. Good.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Take off your shirt.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: All rightie. Shirt coming off. Ta-da! Man nipples.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: I said be quiet.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes, ma’am.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Now take off your shorts.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Taking shorts off. There we go. Naked, naked, naked!

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Wonderful. Now I’ll take off my clothes.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Cool. Uh-oh!

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Here I am, baby. You miss these?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, damn it!

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Oh, Leonard! Already?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, no! No-no-no! The screen froze. It’s probably just buffering, just give it a second.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Fine.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So, how are your mom and dad?

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Yeah, I really don’t want to talk about my parents now.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah. Sure, sure.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (calling from outside)
utterance.content: If your video’s frozen, try resetting the TCP/IP stack.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh! I didn’t even think of that. Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (still off)
utterance.content: You’re welcome. Please let me know when you and your girlfriend are done hogging the bandwidth for your self-abuse. I’m trying to stream a movie on Netflix in here.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Five, six, seven, eight. Tall and tan and young and lovely, the girl from Ipanema goes walking, and when she passes, each one she passes goes…

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Amy. Amy. Amy.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh… You are aware that your ritualistic knocking behaviour is symptomatic of obsessive compulsive disorder?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Is not. Is not, is not.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Denial. Denial, denial. Come in.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Would you like to hear me play a bossa nova standard on the harp?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: How about the theme song to the classic television show Diff’rent Strokes? Now the world don’t move to the beat…

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, that’s every song I know. What’s up?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’re good friends with Penny, right?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Best friends, besties, BFFs, peas in a pod, sisters who would share travelling pants. Go on.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I was hoping she might listen to you about the dangers of owning unhygienic furniture.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: For general educational purposes, or has she acquired a bar stool dipped in cholera?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Cholera is water-borne. You’re mocking me.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Yes, I am.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Penny has dragged a chair in off the street whose unknown provenance jeopardizes the health and welfare of every resident in our building.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon, just because you have a focus on cleanliness bordering on the psychotic doesn’t mean I have to participate.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right, name your price.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Kiss me where I’ve never been kissed before.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You mean like Salt Lake City?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Never mind. I’ll talk to Penny.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Will you listen to me play my harp now?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No. I dislike the sound of the harp. Its overuse in classic television sitcoms always makes me think I’m going to experience an episode from my past. I’m sorry, Mommy. Don’t be mad at me. Don’t do that!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t know about this, Howard.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What? You’re having trouble with the long-distance lovemaking. This is your answer. There are two interfaces that simulate a human mouth. You have one, Priya has one in India. When you move your lips and tongue on yours, it transmits exactly what you’re doing to hers. See? Internet kissing. Give it a try.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t think so.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’ll try it. Like this?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Almost. Really get your tongue in there, to activate the motion sensor.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Like this?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Close. Really French it.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Better?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, you got it, you got it.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’m impressed. This is very lifelike.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Whoa! You just bit my tongue!

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I, I nibbled. I was being playful.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Why do you have to make everything weird?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Sorry. Better?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, yeah.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Pretty cool, huh? Probably would cost, like, two hundred bucks in a store.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I do appreciate a bargain. This entire ensemble once belonged to my dead grandmother.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You’re kidding.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Everything except bra and panties. And they’re a leopard-spotted secret I share with Victoria.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: And now me.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I just have one question about the chair.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: And what’s that?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Aren’t you worried about it being unhygienic?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, it’s completely fine. Hmm. I get it. Sheldon sent you. He put you up to this.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No, he didn’t.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Yes, he did. He absolutely did.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: My God, Amy, that’s really crappy of you.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: It is?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah! Letting Sheldon use you to manipulate me? I thought you were my friend.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No, I am your friend. Please don’t be mad at me.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I can’t even believe this. You know, maybe you should just go.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No, no, I’m sorry, I’m so sorry. I take it all back. Look. I’m, uh, I’m sitting in your chair. There’s nothing wrong with it. It’s a great chair. Please let me continue to be part of your world. Ow!

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What’s wrong?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Something in the chair’s biting my tushy. It’s not important. Ow!

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Wait. Get up, get up! Swear you won’t tell Sheldon what happened!

utterance.speaker: Amy (between screams)
utterance.content: I swear! Can I tell my doctor? I’m probably gonna need shots!

utterance.speaker: Penny (also still screaming)
utterance.content: Yeah, sure!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, hey, babe, I think I figured this thing out.

utterance.speaker: Priya (on screen)
utterance.content: Oh, Leonard, listen…

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, you listen. You’re my woman, and I’m gonna make you feel things you have never felt before.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Leonard…

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s right, say my name, and beg me for more, ’cause, I’m gonna give it to you.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: My parents are here.

utterance.speaker: Dr Koothrappali
utterance.content: Hello, Leonard, if I may also say your name.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Check it out. Free chair.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah. Hey, you know, if this was in Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment, I wouldn’t wind up sitting on the floor all the time.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: On three?

utterance.speaker: Together
utterance.content: Three!

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What kind of idiot throws away a terrific chair like this?
